alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 12:37AM CDT until June 18 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Rogers County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southwestern Delaware County in northeastern Oklahoma... Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Adair County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northern Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 130 AM CDT. * At 1236 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Collinsville to Inola to 3 miles southwest of Taft, moving east at 60 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS!. HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. * Locations in or near the path include... Claremore... Wagoner... Jay... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Chouteau... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Colcord... Kansas... Adair... Spavinaw... Disney... Oaks... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Peggs... Cherokee State Park... Rose... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 250 and 266. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: These are potentially deadly storms. Seek shelter in an interior room on the lowest floor of a well-built structure. Abandon vehicles in search of a more substantial permanent structure. Stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes; Rogers; Wagoner
